speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about when you first started feeling unwell, was it suddenly or did it come on gradually?

speaker: Patient
text: "It started a few days ago, I guess. I was just feeling really anxious and restless, like I couldn't shake off this feeling of being really wired. It's hard to explain, but it just got worse and worse over the past 24 hours."

speaker: Doctor
text: I see. Can you tell me more about this feeling of being "wired"? Does it feel like you're having trouble sleeping, or is it more about feeling alert and awake all the time?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's like I'm on high alert all the time, but at the same time, I feel really irritable and short-tempered. I just can't seem to calm down or relax, even when I'm trying to sleep. My mind is racing and I feel like I'm constantly on edge."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your daily activities over the past few days? Have you noticed any changes in your appetite, energy levels, or urination habits?

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, I've been trying to stay awake and focused, but I've been avoiding social situations and just kinda hanging out at home. As for changes in appetite, I don't really notice anything different, but I have been feeling really nauseous and lightheaded at times. And yeah, I've been urinating more often than usual, but that's probably just the anxiety and dehydration from not drinking enough water."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about these social situations you've been avoiding? Are you avoiding them because you're feeling anxious or is there something else going on? Also, I'd like to take a look at your hands. Can you show me your hands, please?

speaker: Patient
text: "I've just been feeling really overwhelmed and anxious, to be honest. I don't want to be around people right now because I feel like I'm going to say or do something stupid. I've been trying to keep to myself and just focus on getting through the day. As for my hands, they're a bit... yellow, I guess. I've noticed that my skin has been taking on a pretty yellowish hue over the past week or so."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your living situation? Do you have a job, and if so, what kind of work do you do? Also, can you show me your hands again, and I'd like to take a look at your nails and fingernails in particular.

speaker: Patient
text: "I live with my family, we're a pretty close-knit household. I work as a part-time barista, just a few hours a week, but I've been trying to cut back on my shifts lately because I've been feeling really burnt out. As for my hands, like I said, they're a bit yellow. And yeah, my nails are a bit brittle and brittle-looking too. I've been noticing that my skin has been getting this weird yellowish tint for a while now."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your family and living situation? Are there any other family members who work in the service industry, such as food preparation or handling chemicals? Also, I'd like to take a closer look at your nails. Are they brittle, do you notice any brittleness or splitting?

speaker: Patient
text: "My family's pretty normal, we don't work in any service industries that I know of. My mom's a teacher and my dad's a software engineer, my siblings are all in college. I'm the only one who works in the service industry, just part-time at the coffee shop. As for my nails, yeah, they're pretty brittle, I can see them splitting and breaking off easy. And they've been feeling really dry and rough, even when I moisturize them."

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to take a closer look at your nails, can you please show me your fingernails and toenails, and I'd also like to examine your fingernails more closely to see if there's any discoloration or thickening. Also, can you tell me more about your diet over the past week or so? Have you noticed any changes in your food preferences or appetite? And, REQUEST TEST: Complete Blood Count (CBC).

text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Patient
text: "It's pretty noticeable, especially around my eyes. It's like my skin is taking on this... golden hue, and it's spreading upwards towards my face. I've noticed it's a bit more pronounced on my palms and the inside of my wrists, but it's not just limited to those areas. And yeah, my fingernails, they're pretty yellowish too, like I said before. I've got a few white spots on the tips of my index and middle fingers, but nothing too concerning."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the golden hue you mentioned spreading upwards towards your face? Is it more noticeable on one side of your face than the other? text: "It's like it's getting worse, especially around my eyes. It's getting harder to distinguish between my skin and my eyes, they're just this... same color. And the white spots on my fingernails, they're kind of... scattered, but they're getting bigger and more noticeable, I think."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your family's cooking habits? Do you live with anyone who works with chemicals, such as cleaning products or pesticides, that could potentially be causing skin discoloration? And, I'd like to examine your liver more closely. Can you show me your abdomen, please?

text: "It's like it's been getting worse over the past 24 hours, to be honest. I've been trying to relax and still, but it's hard when you're in pain like that."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Thank you for sharing that with me. Based on your symptoms and the ultrasound results, it appears that you have gallbladder disease, possibly cholelithiasis or cholecystitis. The elevated bilirubin levels in your urine and the ultrasound findings suggest that there may be a buildup of bilirubin in your gallbladder, which could be causing your nausea, lightheadedness, and abdominal discomfort. I'm going to recommend that you undergo a cholecystectomy, which is the surgical removal of your gallbladder. This should help alleviate your symptoms and prevent any further complications. However, before we proceed with the surgery, I want to make sure that you're aware of the potential risks and benefits. Can you tell me more about your medical history and any previous surgeries you've had? Are you taking any medications that could interact with the anesthesia or surgery? Also, I'd like to request another test: REQUEST TEST: Blood Test to check for any underlying conditions that may be contributing to your gallbladder disease. Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns about the proposed treatment plan."
